title: Lack of mental health beds contributed to UK teenager’s death, inquest finds
description: Poor communication also cited as factor in death of Ellame Ford-Dunn, 16, on Worthing hospital’s grounds
content:
A shortage of mental health beds and poor communication between agencies contributed to the death of a teenage girl on hospital grounds, an inquest has found.
Ellame Ford-Dunn, 16, who had a history of self-harm, died in March 2022 after absconding f... [3838 chars]

title: US agrees to drop tariffs after India stops Russian oil purchases
description: Tariffs will drop from 50% to 18% on Indian goods, while India has agreed to stop buying Russian oil.
content:
US President Donald Trump announced that he agreed to a trade deal with India's Prime Minister Narendra Modi, where the US will lower tariffs on goods from India to 18% from 25%.
In a post on Truth Social, Trump said India will reduce trade barriers ... [3119 chars]

title: South Wales council to buy and demolish homes prone to flooding
description: Residents of 16 houses on Clydach Terrace in Ynysybwl express relief after repeated floods caused by climate crisis
content:
A row of homes in a village in south Wales is to be bought by a local authority and demolished as they can no longer be protected from flooding caused by the climate crisis.
It will cost Rhondda Cynon Taf county borough council more than £2.5m to buy... [4297 chars]

title: UK weather: Areas of UK hit by record January rainfall
description: Anyone thinking it had been a particularly drab and wet January, that has been confirmed by the Met Office's latest monthly figures, as Chris Fawkes explains.
content:
Official statistics for January have been released by the Met Office and confirm what many will already suspect - it has been very wet for many areas.
Northern Ireland, south-west and southern England, and the east of Scotland all had one of their we... [2618 chars]

title: Crown Princess Mette-Marit's son arrested for alleged assault before rape trial in Norway
description: Marius Borg Høiby, who goes on trial on Tuesday, has been remanded in custody for four weeks after new allegations.
content:
The son of Norway's Crown Princess Mette-Marit has been arrested by police on suspicion of assault, before he goes on trial in Oslo on Tuesday on 38 charges, including the rape of four women.
Marius Borg Høiby, 29, was remanded in custody for four we... [2483 chars]
